meanings.definition: Affected with or relating to amaurosis, a partial or total loss of sight without visible damage to the eye.
meanings.sent1: The amaurotic patient struggled to navigate the dark room.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient as amaurotic after conducting several tests.
meanings.sent3: The amaurotic cat kept bumping into furniture, thinking it was a game.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt amaurotic, unable to see a way out of the difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick, it felt amaurotic, like walking in complete darkness.

meanings.definition: Showing symptoms of amaurosis, such as blindness or visual impairment.
meanings.sent1: The amaurotic child needed special assistance in school due to vision problems.
meanings.sent2: The elderly man's deteriorating eyesight made him increasingly amaurotic.
meanings.sent3: Despite his amaurotic condition, he always found joy in listening to music.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night appeared amaurotic, like distant stars fading away.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered, casting an amaurotic shadow over the landscape.
